chargeHist.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron Verduzco Mendez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay court costs. Pursuant to sec. 973.046(1r), the defendant is required to pay $200.00 DNA surcharge.  Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------------

records.addlTxt: Defendant Aaron  Verduzco Mendez in court with attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Defendant Aaron Verduzco Mendez in court with attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH T.R.K. (dob 5-10-1999). NO CONTACT WITH NATURLAND PARK.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant in court with attorney Sylvie Dehnert. Matthew Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond granted. Minutes filed.
